@graph.caption: Stack of brownies on a white dessert plate.

@graph.name: Best Brownies Recipe {Quick and Easy!} - Cooking Classy
@graph.description: The best Brownies recipe from scratch! They're so easy and amazingly delicious! They're soft and tender, nicely gooey and chewy and perfectly chocolatey.

@graph.name: Brownies
@graph.description: The best Brownie recipe from scratch! They're so easy and unbelievably delicious, plus they use pantry staples so you can make them on those days when those intense chocolate cravings strike. They're soft and tender, nicely gooey and chewy and perfectly chocolatey.
recipeIngredient: 2/3 cup (98g) unbleached all-purpose flour ((scoop and level to measure))
2/3 cup (56g) unsweetened cocoa powder** ((spoon and level))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Spray and 8 by 8-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray, set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Spray and 8 by 8-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray, set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place butter in a large microwave safe bowl. Heat in microwave until just melted. Stir in sugar and salt, let cool slightly if warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Place butter in a large microwave safe bowl. Heat in microwave until just melted. Stir in sugar and salt, let cool slightly if warm.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in eggs and vanilla. Break yolks and stir with wooden spoon just until blended.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in eggs and vanilla. Break yolks and stir with wooden spoon just until blended.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in flour, cocoa powder and chocolate chips. Fold and stir mixture with wooden spoon just until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in flour, cocoa powder and chocolate chips. Fold and stir mixture with wooden spoon just until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour into prepared baking dish. Spread into an even layer. Bake in preheated oven just until barely set, about 40 - 55 minutes (toothpick may have a hint of sticky batter, be careful not to over-bake).
recipeInstructions.name: Pour into prepared baking dish. Spread into an even layer. Bake in preheated oven just until barely set, about 40 - 55 minutes (toothpick may have a hint of sticky batter, be careful not to over-bake).

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool completely on a wire rack before cutting into squares. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool completely on a wire rack before cutting into squares. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
